On this page

Getting Started ‚Äã

This guide will help you set up your development environment and write your first web page.

What You'll Need ‚Äã

1. A Code Editor ‚Äã

A code editor is where you'll write your code. We recommend Visual Studio Code (VS Code):

  • Free and open-source
  • Great extensions for web development
  • Built-in terminal and Git support
  • Available on Windows, Mac, and Linux

Download: code.visualstudio.com

Recommended VS Code Extensions ‚Äã

ExtensionPurpose
Live ServerAuto-reload pages during development
PrettierCode formatting
ESLintJavaScript linting
Auto Rename TagRename paired HTML tags
HTML CSS SupportCSS class autocomplete in HTML

2. A Web Browser ‚Äã

Modern browsers have excellent developer tools:

  • Google Chrome - Most popular, great DevTools
  • Firefox - Excellent for CSS debugging
  • Microsoft Edge - Chromium-based, Windows integrated
  • Safari - Required for testing on Mac/iOS

3. Basic Computer Skills ‚Äã

  • Creating and managing files/folders
  • Using a web browser
  • Typing and editing text

Setting Up Your Workspace ‚Äã

Create a Project Folder ‚Äã

Create a dedicated folder for your web development projects:

üìÅ Projects/
  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÅ my-first-website/
       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÑ index.html
       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÑ styles.css
       ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÑ script.js

Open in VS Code ‚Äã

  1. Open VS Code
  2. Go to File ‚Üí Open Folder
  3. Select your project folder

Your First Web Page ‚Äã

Let's create a simple web page step by step.

Step 1: Create index.html ‚Äã

Create a new file called index.html and add this code:

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>My First Website</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css">
</head>
<body>
    <header>
        <h1>Welcome to My Website</h1>
        <nav>
            <a href="#about">About</a>
            <a href="#contact">Contact</a>
        </nav>
    </header>

    <main>
        <section id="about">
            <h2>About Me</h2>
            <p>Hello! I'm learning web development.</p>
        </section>

        <section id="contact">
            <h2>Contact</h2>
            <p>You can reach me at: example@email.com</p>
        </section>
    </main>

    <footer>
        <p>&copy; 2024 My First Website</p>
    </footer>

    <script src="script.js"></script>
</body>
</html>

Step 2: Create styles.css ‚Äã

Create a new file called styles.css:

css
/* Reset and base styles */
* {
    margin: 0;
    padding: 0;
    box-sizing: border-box;
}

body {
    font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, sans-serif;
    line-height: 1.6;
    color: #333;
}

/* Header styles */
header {
    background: #2c3e50;
    color: white;
    padding: 1rem 2rem;
    display: flex;
    justify-content: space-between;
    align-items: center;
}

header h1 {
    font-size: 1.5rem;
}

nav a {
    color: white;
    text-decoration: none;
    margin-left: 1rem;
}

nav a:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
}

/* Main content */
main {
    max-width: 800px;
    margin: 0 auto;
    padding: 2rem;
}

section {
    margin-bottom: 2rem;
}

h2 {
    color: #2c3e50;
    margin-bottom: 1rem;
}

/* Footer */
footer {
    background: #ecf0f1;
    text-align: center;
    padding: 1rem;
    margin-top: 2rem;
}

Step 3: Create script.js ‚Äã

Create a new file called script.js:

javascript
// Wait for the page to load
document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', () => {
    console.log('Website loaded successfully!');

    // Add a simple interaction
    const header = document.querySelector('header h1');

    header.addEventListener('click', () => {
        alert('Welcome to web development!');
    });
});

Step 4: View Your Page ‚Äã

Option A: Using Live Server (Recommended)

  1. Right-click on index.html in VS Code
  2. Select "Open with Live Server"
  3. Your page opens in the browser with auto-reload

Option B: Direct Browser

  1. Locate your index.html file
  2. Double-click to open in your default browser
  3. Or drag the file into an open browser window

Using Browser Developer Tools ‚Äã

Every modern browser has built-in developer tools. Access them by:

  • Windows/Linux: Press F12 or Ctrl + Shift + I
  • Mac: Press Cmd + Option + I

Key DevTools Panels ‚Äã

PanelPurpose
ElementsInspect and edit HTML/CSS
ConsoleView JavaScript output and errors
NetworkMonitor file loading and API calls
SourcesDebug JavaScript code

Try It: Console ‚Äã

  1. Open DevTools (F12)
  2. Go to the Console tab
  3. Type: console.log('Hello from the console!')
  4. Press Enter

You should see your message appear!

Learning Tips ‚Äã

Practice Regularly ‚Äã

  • Code every day, even if just for 15 minutes
  • Build small projects to reinforce learning
  • Don't just read‚Äîtype out the code yourself

Break Things (Intentionally) ‚Äã

  • Experiment with changing values
  • See what happens when you remove code
  • Learning from errors is valuable

Use Resources ‚Äã

  • MDN Web Docs - Comprehensive documentation
  • W3Schools - Beginner-friendly tutorials
  • Stack Overflow - Community Q&A

Start Small ‚Äã

  • Begin with simple pages
  • Add features one at a time
  • Don't try to learn everything at once

Common Beginner Mistakes ‚Äã

MistakeSolution
Forgetting to save filesEnable auto-save in VS Code
Missing closing tagsUse editor extensions to help
Typos in file namesCheck spelling, case matters
Not refreshing the browserUse Live Server for auto-reload
Copying code without understandingType it out and experiment

Project Ideas to Practice ‚Äã

Beginner Projects ‚Äã

  1. Personal bio page
  2. Recipe card
  3. Photo gallery
  4. Favorite quotes page

After Learning More ‚Äã

  1. Calculator
  2. To-do list
  3. Weather display
  4. Simple game

Summary ‚Äã

  • VS Code is the recommended code editor
  • Start with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript files
  • Use Live Server for development
  • Browser DevTools are essential for debugging
  • Practice regularly and build projects

What's Next? ‚Äã

You're now ready to start learning! Begin with:

  • HTML Tutorial - Learn to structure web pages
  • CSS Tutorial - Style your websites
  • JavaScript Tutorial - Add interactivity

TIP

Bookmark this tutorials site and work through each section systematically. Happy coding!
